__data__.text:
#  How to Apply for Rwandan Nationality by Acquisition - Statelessness 

Modified on: Fri, 23 May, 2025 at 12:17 PM

Rwandan nationality by acquisition on the grounds of statelessness is granted to an applicant or beneficiary who is a stateless person on the territory of Rwanda on the date of application and does not threaten national security. The follow-up time is 6 months after receipt of the application. The service is provided by the Directorate-General of Immigration and Emigration.

  

The processing time is 180 days, and the service price is RWF 10,000.

  

Prerequisites:

  * Applicants without an IremboGov account can apply for this service.

  * Applicant should have a foreign /refugee ID, refugee travel document, CEPGL, Laissez-passer, or any other form of identification.

Required attachments (4)

  * Recommendation issued by Executive Secretary of the Cell of your residence

  * Letter addressed to the Director General of Immigration applying for nationality

  * Detailed CV

  * Passport photo of the applicant

Optional attachments (2)

  * Birth certificate

  * A certificate of properties in Rwanda or employment (If any)

  

Follow the following steps to apply for Rwandan nationality by Acquisition - Statelessness.

  

  1. Visit IremboGov platform at [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) under Immigration and Emigration Services. Click on Rwandan nationality by acquisition.

  2. Select “the ground of application by statelessness”; click apply.

  3. Fill in the applicant's details, identification type, date of birth, civil status, etc.

  4. Upload the required documents in the correct format.

  5. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

  

  6. A billing Number/ID (88…) will be generated for payment, Click Pay.

  

  7. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

  

Note:  
  

  * Upon payment, your application will be processed by DGIE.

__data__.text:
#  How to Apply for Rwandan Nationality by Acquisition - Adoption. 

Modified on: Fri, 23 May, 2025 at 10:51 AM

Rwandan nationality by acquisition on the ground of adoption is given to a foreign child who is adopted by a Rwandan and does not threaten national security. The follow-up time is six months after the application is received. The service is provided by the Directorate-General of Immigration and Emigration ( DGIE).

  

The processing time depends on the case; the service price is RWF 10,000.

  

Prerequisites:

  * Applicants without an IremboGov account can apply for this service.

  * Adoptees should have a foreign /refugee ID, refugee travel document, CEPGL, Laissez-passer, or any other form of identification.

Required attachments: (8)

  * Court judgment (PDF)

  * Adoption record issued by Rwandan Civil Registrar

  * Recommendation letter from the National Child Development Agency

  * Birth record

  * Copy of the Rwandan National ID of an adoptive parent

  * Application letter for Rwandan nationality by adoptive parent

  * Proof of properties in the country, activities/occupation of the adoptive parent

  * Passport photo of the adoptee

Conditional attachments (4)

  * Copy of passport (adoptee)

  * Copy of laissez passer (adoptee)

  * Copy of the identification document (adoptee)

  * Residence permit (adoptee)

  

Follow the following steps to apply for Rwandan nationality Acquisition by Adoption.

  

  1. Visit IremboGov platform at [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) under Immigration and Emigration Services. Click on Rwandan nationality by acquisition.

  

  

  2. Select “the ground of application by adoption” and click Apply.

  

  3. Fill in the adoptive parent's and adoptee's details and identification document number.

  

  4. Upload the required documents in the correct format.

  5. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

  6. A billing Number/ID (88…) will be generated for payment, Click Pay.

  7. Applicants choose the mode of payment.

__data__.text:
#  How to Apply for Rwandan Nationality by Acquisition - Marriage. 

Modified on: Fri, 23 May, 2025 at 10:46 AM

Rwandan nationality by acquisition on the ground of marriage is applied by a foreigner legally married to a Rwandan national for at least five (5) years on the date of application, still living in marital union with his or her spouse, and being a person of integrity and of good conduct.

  
Follow-up time: Six months after reception of application. The service is provided by the Directorate-General of Immigration and Emigration ( DGIE).

  

The service price is RWF 10,000.

  

Prerequisites:

  * Applicants without an IremboGov account can apply for this service.

  * Applicants with passports should have an ordinary, diplomatic, or service passport.

  * Applicants should have a National ID/foreign /refugee ID, refugee travel document, Cepegl, Laissez-passer, or any other form of identification.

  

Follow the following steps to apply for Rwandan nationality acquisition by marriage.

  

  1. Visit IremboGov platform at [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) under Immigration and Emigration Services. Click on Rwandan nationality by acquisition.

  2. Select “the ground of application by marriage” and click Apply.

  

  3. Fill in the applicant’s details and identification document type, residence details, phone number, and email.

  4. Enter the spouse's national ID number, date, and country of marriage.

  5. Upload the required documents in the correct format.

  6. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

  7. A billing Number/ID (88…) will be generated for payment, Click Pay.

  8. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

Note:

  

  * Upon payment, your application will be processed by DGIE. You will receive an email or SMS notifying you about any change in the status of your application.

__data__.text:
#  How to Apply for Rwandan Nationality by Acquisition - Residence. 

Modified on: Fri, 23 May, 2025 at 12:24 PM

Rwandan nationality by acquisition on ground of residing in Rwanda is granted to a person who has legally resided and physically lived on the territory of Rwanda for at least fifteen (15) years on the date of application and is characterized by integrity and good conduct.  
  
Follow-up time: Six months after reception of application. The service is provided by the Directorate-General of Immigration and Emigration ( DGIE).

  

The service price is RWF 10,000 and the processing time is 180 days

  

Prerequisites:

  * Applicants without an IremboGov account can apply for this service.

  * Applicants with passports should have an ordinary, diplomatic, or service passport.

  * Applicants should have a National ID/foreign /refugee ID, refugee travel document, CEPGL, Laissez-passer, or any other form of identification.

  

Follow the following steps to apply for Rwandan nationality Acquisition by Residence.

  

  1. Visit IremboGov platform at [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) under Immigration and Emigration Services. Click on Rwandan nationality by acquisition.

  2. Select “the ground of application by Residence” and click Apply.

  3. Fill in the applicant’s details and identification document type, residence details, phone number, and email. Enter your parent's names, entry date in Rwanda and visa or permit type.

  4. Upload the required documents in the correct format.

  5. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

  

  6. A billing Number/ID (88…) will be generated for payment. Click Pay.

  

  7. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

Note:

  * Upon payment, your application will be processed by DGIE. You will receive an email or SMS notifying you about any change in the status of your application.

#  How to Apply for Rwandan Nationality by Acquisition - Substantial and Sustainable Investments. 

Modified on: Sat, 8 Jun, 2024 at 12:07 PM

Rwandan nationality by acquisition on the grounds of substantial and sustainable investment is granted to individuals who have made significant and lasting investments or engaged in activities within Rwanda. To qualify for this nationality, an applicant must possess a document issued by a relevant ministry detailing his/her substantial and sustainable investment or activities in Rwanda, which serves as a justification for granting Rwandan nationality. 

  

Follow-up time: six months after the reception of the application. 

  

The service is provided by the Directorate-General of Immigration and Emigration ( DGIE).

  

The service price is RWF 10,000.

  

Prerequisites:

  * Applicants without an IremboGov account can apply for this service.

  * Applicants with passports should have an ordinary, diplomatic, or service passport.

  * Applicants should have a national ID/foreign /refugee ID, refugee travel document, CEPGL, laissez-passer, or any other form of identification.

  

  

Follow the following steps to apply for Rwandan nationality acquisition through substantial and sustainable investments.

  

  1. Visit IremboGov platform at [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) under Immigration and Emigration Services. Click on Rwandan nationality by acquisition.

  

  

  2. Select “Ground of application by substantial, sustainable investments” and click Apply.

  

  

  

  3. Fill in the applicant’s details and identification document type, residence details, phone number, and email. Enter your parent's names, residence details, etc.  

  4. Upload the required documents in the correct format.

  

  5. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click Submit.

  

  6. A billing Number/ID (88…) will be generated for payment. Click Pay.

  

  7. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

Note:

  * Upon payment, your application will be processed by DGIE.

#  How to Apply for Refugee Travel Document First Application. 

Modified on: Mon, 25 Nov, 2024 at 12:56 PM

This service allows refugees to request an official travel document. The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE). 

  

The processing time is 2 days, and the price is RWF 20,000.

  

Prerequisites:

  * Applicants with or without an IremboGov account can apply for this service.

  * Click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001145950-how-to-create-an-account>) to create an account

  * Applicants should have UNHCR Proof of Registration number

  * Applicants should have a valid phone number, email address, or both. 

Conditional attachments

1\. Copy of proof of registration, Passport photo, Signature

2\. Parents' marriage certificate or any other proof of marriage

3\. Child birth certificate

4\. Death certificate of the deceased parent, 

5\. Copy of a legal guardianship, Copy of the guardian's identity card, or Copy of parents divorce court judgment

6\. Certificate of celibacy for the mother or Certificate of Recognition

Optional attachments (4)

1\. Copy of valid refugee card

2\. Copy of the refugee card of the mother

3\. A copy of the living parent's Identity card

4\. Refugee registration certificate

  

Follow these simple steps to apply for a Refugee Travel Document first application: 

  1. Visit www.irembo.gov.rw,  and under Immigration and Emigration, click on Refugee Travel Document Application. 

  

  2. Select “Refugee Travel Document first application” and click on Apply. 

  3. Fill in the applicant details as prompted.

  

  

4\. Enter the travel details, such as the destination country and travel purpose.

5\. Upload the required attachments in the correct format and click Next.

6\. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

7\. A billing number/ID (88….) will be generated for payment. Click pay.

8\. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

NOTE: After applying and paying successfully via IremboGov, the applicant receives a feedback notification from the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration informing them when to take the biometric tests, either at DGIE headquarters or at a district office.

#  How to Renew Refugee Travel Document 

Modified on: Mon, 25 Nov, 2024 at 1:07 PM

This service allows refugees to request a renewal of an official refugee travel document. Reasons for renewing include a valid passport with full stamped pages, passport validity is less than 6 months, and others. The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE) . 

  

The processing time is 2 days, and the price is RWF 20,000.

  

Prerequisites

  * Applicants with or without an IremboGov account can apply for this service.

  * Click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001145950-how-to-create-an-account>) to create an account

  * Applicants should have UNHCR Proof of Registration number

  * A Refugee national ID for adults

  * A copy of the previous travel document that is being renewed.

  * Applicants should have a valid phone number, email address, or both. 

Required attachments

Existing refugee travel document

Conditional attachments (11)

1\. Copy of proof of registration

2\. Passport photo

3\. Signature

4\. Parents' marriage certificate or any other proof of marriage

5\. Child birth certificate

6\. Death certificate of the deceased parent

7\. Copy of a legal guardianship

8\. Copy of the guardian's identity card

9\. Copy of parents divorce court judgment

10\. Certificate of celibacy for the mother

11\. Certificate of Recognition

Optional attachments (4)

1\. Copy of valid refugee card

2\. Copy of the refugee card of the mother

3\. A copy of the living parent's Identity card

4\. Refugee registration certificate

  

  

Follow these simple steps to renew the refugee travel document: 

  1. Visit [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) and under Immigration and Emigration, click on Refugee Travel Document Application. 

  

  2. Select “Refugee Travel Document first application” and click on Apply. 

  3. Fill in the applicant details as prompted.

  

  

4\. Enter the travel details, such as the destination country, travel purpose, and reasons for travel.

Note: Once you confirm that you live in a refugee camp, the collection place will automatically be set to that camp.

5\. Upload the required attachments in the correct format and click Next.

6\. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

7\. A billing number/ID (88….) will be generated for payment. Click pay.

8\. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

NOTE: After applying and paying successfully via IremboGov, the applicant receives a feedback notification from the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration informing them when to take the biometric tests, either at DGIE headquarters or at a district office.

__data__.text:
#  How to Apply for a Resident ID Card first application 

Modified on: Mon, 26 May, 2025 at 11:07 AM

This service allows foreigners residing in Rwanda to apply for a resident ID to use in Rwanda. Foreigners with valid permits are eligible to get the resident ID card. The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE) office. 

  

The processing time is 7 days, and the price is RWF 5,000.

  

Prerequisites: 

  * Applicants must be 16 years old and above.

  * Applicants can apply for this service with or without an Irembo account.

  * Applicants should have any travel document, such as a valid passport or laissez-passer, etc.

  * Applicants should have a passport and a Rwandan permit valid for longer than 6 months.

  * Applicants should have a valid phone number, email address, or both. 

  

Follow these simple steps to apply for a resident ID card: 

  1. Visit [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) and under Immigration and Emigration, click on Resident ID Card. 

  2. Select “Resident ID card first application” and click on Apply. 

  3. Fill in the applicant details, permit number, date of birth, and place of collection, then click on Next to proceed. 

  4. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

  5. A billing number/ID (88….) will be generated for payment click pay.

  6. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

NOTE: After applying and paying successfully via IremboGov, the applicant receives a feedback notification from the DGIE informing them to visit their office for further instructions about their application.

#  How to Apply for a Replacement of Resident ID Card 

Modified on: Mon, 26 May, 2025 at 11:12 AM

The resident ID is a form of local identification issued to foreigners living in Rwanda. The reasons for replacement include: lost, stolen, damaged, or correction. This application requires the applicant to be 16 years old and above, have a passport, and have a Rwandan permit for longer than 6 months. If you haven't applied for a resident ID, apply for a new ID. The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE) office. 

  

The processing time is 5 days, and the price depends on the reason for replacement.

  

Prerequisites: 

  * Applicants must be 16 years old and above.

  * Applicants can apply for this service with or without an Irembo account.

  * Applicants should have any travel document, such as a valid passport or laissez-passer, etc.

  * Applicants should have valid permits.

  * Applicants should have a passport and Rwandan permit valid for longer than 6 months.

  * The applicant should have an existing resident ID card number.

  * Applicants should have a valid phone number, email address, or both. 

  

Follow these simple steps to replace the resident ID card: 

  1. Visit [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) and under Immigration and Emigration, click on Resident ID Card. 

  2. Select “Replacement of resident ID card” and click on Apply. 

  3. Fill in the applicant details, travel document number, existing resident ID card, and place of collection, then click on Next to proceed. 

  4. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

  5. A billing number/ID (88….) will be generated for payment click pay.

  6. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

NOTE: After applying and paying successfully via IremboGov, the applicant receives a feedback notification from the DGIE informing them to visit their office for further instructions about their application.

#  How to Apply for a Renewal of Resident ID Card 

Modified on: Mon, 26 May, 2025 at 11:21 AM

The resident ID is a form of local identification issued to foreigners living in Rwanda. This application requires the applicant to be 16 years old and above; he/she must have a passport and Rwandan Permit that is valid for longer than 6 months. You can only renew your ID if it has expired. The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE) office. 

  

The processing time is 5 days, and the price is RWF 5,000.

  

Prerequisites: 

  * Applicants must be 16 years old and above.

  * Applicants can apply for this service with or without an Irembo account.

  * Applicants should have any travel document, such as a valid passport or laissez-passer, etc.

  * Applicants should have valid permits.

  * Applicants should have a passport and Rwandan permit valid for longer than 6 months.

  * The applicant should have an existing resident ID card number.

  * Applicants should have a valid phone number, email address, or both. 

Follow these simple steps to replace the resident ID card: 

  1. Visit [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) and under Immigration and Emigration, click on Foreign ID Card. 

  

  2. Select “Renewal of resident ID card” and click on Apply.

  3. Fill in the applicant details, travel document number, existing resident ID card, and place of collection, then click on Next to proceed.

  4. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

  5. A billing number/ID (88….) will be generated for payment. Click Pay.

  6. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

NOTE: After applying and paying successfully via IremboGov, the applicant receives a feedback notification from the DGIE informing them to visit their office for further instructions about their application.

**How to Apply for a CEPGL Travel Document** **Related articles**
Modified on: Fri, 23 May, 2025 at 3:50 PM
The CEPGL travel document is issued to a Rwandan or a foreigner legally residing in Rwanda, allowing him/her to travel to member states of the Economic Community of the Great Lakes Countries, which are Burundi and Democratic Republic of Congo. The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE) office.
The validity of this document for Rwandan nationals is 6 months and 3 months for foreign expatriate residents in Rwanda. The processing time for this service is 1 day.
Rwandan nationals (adults & minors) pay 1000 Rwf or 1 USD, while foreigners pay 10,000 Rwf or 10 USD
**Prerequisites:**
* Applicants with or without an Irembo account can apply for this service.
* Adult Rwandan nationals (above 18 years) should have a national ID number.
* Rwandan Minors between 16 years and 18 years should have a national ID number.
* Rwandan Minors below 16 years should have the Citizen Application Number.
* Rwandan Minors below 16 years without the child application number can still apply for the service.
* Foreigners should have a passport number.
* Attachments differ depending on the **Nationality Type** for adults, and on the **Minor Category** for minors.
* Attachments should fulfill the following:
* Scanned copy of National ID has to be 500kb, format pdf
* Scanned passport photo has to be 200kb, format jpg
* Scanned signature has to be 50kb, format jpg
* Other documents have to be 500kb and pdf format **only**.
* Applicants should have a valid phone number, email address, or both.
**Follow these simple steps to apply for a CEPGL Travel Document:**
1. Visit **www.irembo.gov.rw** and under Immigration and Emigration, click on **CEPGL Service.**
**![][image1]**
2. Select the service “**CEPGL New Application**,” and click on **Apply**.
![][image2]
3. Choose who needs this service; whether the applicant is a Rwandan or a foreigner.
* If the applicant is a foreigner (adult & minor), he/she enters the passport number.
* If an applicant is a Rwandan above 18, he/she enters their national ID.
* If an applicant is a Rwandan below 18, he/she enters the Citizen Application Number.
* If the applicant is a Rwandan below 18 and doesn’t have a Citizen Application Number he/she enters their information as well as their guardian’s information.
4. Fill in the **Applicant Details** and the details will be retrieved and displayed on the right side of the page.
![][image3]
5. Attach all the **required documents** in the right format and size.
1. Attachments depend on the **Nationality Type**.
2. For Rwandan minors, attachments depend on the **Minor Category**.
6. Click on **Next** to proceed.
![][image4]
7. Verify that the information is true, enter a p**hone number and/or email address**, check the verification box, and click on **Submit**.
8. A **billing Number/ID** (88…) will be generated for payment, Click **Pay**.
9. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click here.
**NOTE:** After applying and successfully paying via IremboGov, the applicant receives a feedback notification from the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration informing them to visit their office for further instructions about their application.

﻿How to Apply for a Foreign Travel Document
Modified on: Mon, 11 Jul, 2022 at 7:53 PM
This service allows foreigners to request an emergency travel document. The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE) office. 
The processing time is 7 days and the price depends on the desired travel document.
 Prerequisites: 
* Applicants should first contact DGIE before applying for this service.
* Applicants should have a passport number.
* Applicant should have both a valid phone number, email address, or both. 
Follow these simple steps to apply for a foreign travel document: 
1. Visit www.irembo.gov.rw and under Immigration and Emigration, click on Foreign Travel Document. 
  

2. Click on Apply. 
  

3. Fill in the Applicant Details and click on Next to proceed. 
  

4. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit. 
5. A billing number/ID (99….) will be generated for payment. Applicants can pay using MTN Mobile Money, Airtel Money, BK App, BK Branches, BK Agents, or pay online using VISA or MasterCard.
NOTE: After applying and paying successfully via IremboGov, the applicant receives a feedback notification from the DGIE informing them to visit their office for further instructions about their application.
